notes: Crashes after the change of the resolution. After the restart it works fine.

title: Supreme Commander 2
notes:
Initial startup was long.  Subsequent startups acceptable.  

Does not allow BT audio streaming although native Linux games (and this on a Windows 8.1 install) have caused no such issue.

Performance seems to match that in Windows 8.1 which is able to use SLI 650M.

title: Supreme Commander 2
notes: Excellent performance (on max settings); didn't crash when changing resolution

title: Supreme Commander 2
notes: The mouse pointer is blinking while in the main menu, also in the main menu there are some fast screen freezes, the FPS is oscillating a bit and there is a weird screen size issue (Most scales seem ok, but the game crashed at 1440x960 and when I was back in-game all the models had black clones side by side). Anyway, it's playable. My graphics card is not the best.

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) R9 Fury Series (FIJI, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.9-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Everything worked, despite a few freezes in-game. Everything maxed (including AA and AF). Did not crash when switching resolution. Didn't try a second monitor, nor multiplayer. Played a quick skirmish with the DLC on.
